description: From Middle English handcrafte, handecraft, hond-craft, from Old English handcræft, equivalent to hand +‎ craft. Cognate with Dutch handkracht, German Handkraft.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) The class of subjects for study that rely upon experimentation and observation.

verbs.description: handcraft (third-person singular simple present handcrafts, present participle handcrafting, simple past and past participle handcrafted)

entries.meaning: To engage in handcraft or handicraft.
